thread.title: Heat wave record tied, could fall Friday
thread.title_full: Heat wave record tied, could fall Friday | The Seattle Times

author: Jack Broom
title: Heat wave record tied, could fall Friday
text:
The Puget Sound area’s heat wave tied a 38-year-old record by about 3 p.m. Thursday when the temperature at Seattle-Tacoma International Airport reached 80 degrees for a 15th consecutive day.
That tied a mark set in late July and early August of 1977.
A record would be set if Friday’s temperature at the airport hits 80, but the forecast is calling for a bit of a cool-down, with a high of about 77.
Related features Spectacular photos of Seattle’s hazy sunsets
Haze from Canadian wildfires spreads across many U.S. states
Hot enough for you? Share your Northwest rain pictures (and say ahhh)
With moist air moving in from the Pacific Ocean, a chance of showers in the Seattle area is expected to build over the weekend, with a 20 percent chance of showers Saturday night and 30 percent chance Sunday.
The current heat streak at Sea-Tac, where Seattle’s official readings are taken, included five straight days in the 90s (beginning July 1), four of which set daily temperature records, ranging from 91 to 93.
The normal high for this time of July is 75.
The highest temperature ever recorded at Sea-Tac was 103 on July 29, 2009, which came in the midst of a 10-day stretch of temperatures topping 80 degrees.
Jack Broom: jbroom@seattletimes.com or 206-464-2222
